qas.question: In place of instruments, what do some modern a cappella groups implement?
Where does a cappella still maintain a heavy presence?
In a cappella, what do the voices not contributing lead vocals or a bass line contribute?
What has been added to contemporary instrumental music?

plausible_answers.text: Straight No Chaser, Pentatonix, The House Jacks, Rockapella, Mosaic, and M-pact.

qas.question: What are examples of instrumental bands?
What has maintained a strong presence in all types of worship?

plausible_answers.text: one voice singing the lead melody, one singing a rhythmic bass line, and the remaining voices contributing chordal or polyphonic accompaniment

qas.question: What do arrangments for popular secular music include?
What music type includes bands who add instruments to create a pop/rock/gospel sound?
In Christian music who uses beatboxing during worship?
What do some a cappella groups use instead of chordal accompanyment?
Where does one voice singing still remain strong?
What groups don't use vocal percussion during worship?

context: <b7_0>Contemporary a cappella<b7_0/> includes many vocal groups and bands who add <a0_0><b3_0><b9_0>vocal percussion<a0_0/> or beatboxing<b9_0/><b3_0/> to create a pop/rock/gospel sound, in some cases very similar to bands with instruments. Examples of such professional groups include <b4_0>Straight No Chaser, Pentatonix, The House Jacks, Rockapella, Mosaic, and M-pact.<b4_0/> There also remains a strong <b5_0>a cappella<b5_0/> presence <b10_0>within <a1_0>Christian music<b10_0/><a1_0/>, as <b8_0><b11_0>some denominations<b11_0/><b8_0/> purposefully do not use instruments during worship. Examples of such groups are Take 6, Glad and Acappella. Arrangements of popular music for small a cappella ensembles typically include <b6_0>one voice singing the lead melody, one singing a rhythmic bass line, and the remaining voices contributing <a2_0>chordal or polyphonic accompaniment<b6_0/><a2_0/>.
